question: Which sea formed the location of the "Harman's Martinican Bonfire"?
explanation: Harmanâ€™s Martinican Bonfire, also known as the Battle of Martinique, was a major naval battle fought between France and England in the Martinique Island, one of the several islands in the West Indies region of the Caribbean Sea. This battle was fought from 30 June 1667 to 7 July 1667. English naval fleet attacked the French mercantile fleet to secure the English domination in the West Indies region. This battle led to the decisive English victory.
